page.title: 05FARMING 50 YEARS AGO
page.content: It was hard work and you got very little pay.Farmers had more people working for them (10 to 12 men).Every farm had a variety of animals and grew different crops.Most farms had horses (Clydesdale or Shire).They were used for reaping,ploughing,carting goods and sowing.They worked from 3 till 20 years of age.At 6 am. the horses were fed on oats and chaff.They'd get the machine out and check it,harness the horses up and go to the fields.At 7.00 am. they'd start working.They carried on till 12.15 pm. with only a short break.They fed the horses and in half an hour back to work.11 men would be threshing while another 5 or 6 started building stooks.At 7.30 pm. they'd pack up and go home to tea and{ bed down the horses for the night and feed them. At the end of the harvest, the farmer gave his men a good feast.
